title: Tomato Salad with Onions (Tamatem bell Bassal)
ingredients: 1 pound firm vine ripe tomatoes, sliced
1 large red onion; or, a large sweet yellow onion
1 tablespoon wine vinegar; or, the juice of ½ lemon
instructions: Wash and slice the tomatoes.  Place the sliced tomato in a bowl with the onions and cilantro (or the parsley).
Dress the salad with a mixture of oil and vinegar or the lemon juice.  Add salt and pepper, to taste, and toss.  Sprinkle with the cumin (if using) and serve.
remarks: In my opinion, I would allow the sliced tomatoes to cool in the refrigerator for at least a half hour before dressing them with the oil and vinegar mixture.  I just think the salad would be better if the tomatoes were chilled.
source: Appetizers, Salads and Cold Vegetables, The New Book of Middle Eastern Food by Claudia Roden, Random Hourse, Inc., New York, © 2000 by Claudia Roden.
